n-inv-neg-concord: There is no negative subject nor negative auxiliary; no negative concord.
aint: The general negator 'ain’t' does not appear.
zero-3sg-pres-s: The subject is 'we' and the finite verb is past 'saw', not a 3sg present with missing -s.
is-was-gen: No 'is/was' with nonstandard agreement occurs; only 'saw' is finite.
zero-pl-s: The plural noun 'helicopters' is marked with plural -s; no missing plural marking.
double-object: No personal dative pattern (e.g., 'we had us NP'); the structure is 'we saw NP'.
wh-qu1: There is no WH-question; the utterance is declarative.
wh-qu2: No WH-clause is present, so no nonstandard inversion can apply.
existential-it: No existential 'it' construction appears.
demonstrative-them: 'Them' is not used as a determiner; it does not appear.
appositive-pleonastic-pronoun: No NP is followed by a co-referential pronoun in the same clause.
verb-stem: The past event is marked by 'saw'; no bare finite verb is used with past reference.
past-tense-swap: 'Saw' is the standard preterite; no participle-as-past or overregularized past form is used.
zero-rel-pronoun: No finite subject relative clause lacks a relative pronoun; 'flying' is a nonfinite modifier.
preterite-had: There is no 'had' used to mark simple past.
bare-got: No 'got' expressing present possession is present.

sentence: We was trying to wave thems down, seem like they was getting the ones over on the rooftop, cause I did saw a few-  I could look down the street and see a few on- on- on the rooftop.
zero-poss: No noun–noun juxtaposition or nonstandard possessive pronoun expressing possession occurs; phrases like 'the ones over on the rooftop' are not possessive.
zero-copula: Copular/progressive BE is overt where needed (e.g., 'We was trying', 'they was getting'); no clear subject–predicate slot lacks BE.
double-tense: No single verb shows duplicated past morphology like -ed-ed; 'did saw' is double past across words, not within one word.
be-construction: No uninflected finite 'be' with habitual/generic meaning appears; only 'was' occurs.
resultant-done: No aspectual 'done' before a verb phrase (e.g., 'done ate') is present.
come: No stance/evaluative 'come' before a VP appears; 'come' is absent.
double-modal: Only a single modal occurs ('I could look...'); there is no sequence like 'might could'.
multiple-neg: There are no clauses with more than one negative element; no 'ain't/never/nothing' combination appears.
neg-inversion: No clause-initial negative auxiliary preceding the subject (e.g., 'Don't nobody...') occurs.
n-inv-neg-concord: No negative subject paired with a negative auxiliary (e.g., 'Nobody don't...') appears.
aint: The form 'ain’t' is not used as a negator anywhere in the utterance.
zero-3sg-pres-s: There is no clear 3sg subject with a bare present verb; 'seem like...' lacks an overt 3sg subject and is syntactically underspecified.
is-was-gen: 'We was trying' and 'they was getting' use 'was' with plural subjects, showing generalized 'was' regardless of person/number.
zero-pl-s: No plural noun lacks -s; 'ones' is correctly pluralized and other plurals are not locally marked without -s.
double-object: No personal dative pattern like 'We had us a...' appears; there is no verb + coreferential object pronoun + NP sequence.
wh-qu1: There are no WH-questions with missing BE/DO (e.g., 'What you want?').
wh-qu2: No WH-questions or embedded WH-clauses with nonstandard inversion occur.
existential-it: No existential 'it' construction introducing new entities (e.g., 'It’s people...') occurs.
demonstrative-them: 'them(s)' appears as an object pronoun in 'wave thems down', not as a demonstrative determiner before a noun.
appositive-pleonastic-pronoun: No NP is followed by a co-referential resumptive pronoun in the same clause.
bin: No 'been/BIN' occurs without 'have' to mark long-standing aspect.
verb-stem: 'seem like they was getting...' occurs within a past narrative frame set by 'We was trying...', using bare finite 'seem' where SAE would use past 'seemed'.
past-tense-swap: No participle/preterite swap like 'seen' as simple past or 'had bit' appears; 'did saw' is nonstandard after 'did' but not covered by this swap rule.
zero-rel-pronoun: No subject relative clause modifies a noun without 'who/that/which' (e.g., no 'mothers don’t know...' type structure).
preterite-had: There is no 'had' + past verb used for simple past meaning.

sentence: And uh, I did saw someone climbing up    uh, uh I guess it was a sheet, to try to get off of  something, trying to get  uh, uh, up on the roof.
zero-poss: No noun–noun juxtaposition or nonstandard possessive pronoun expresses possession in the clause.
zero-copula: All copular uses of BE are overt (e.g., 'it was a sheet'); no required BE is missing.
double-tense: There is no duplicated past morpheme within a single verb word; 'did saw' is aux+past, not within one word.
be-construction: Uninflected habitual 'be' does not appear anywhere in the utterance.
resultant-done: No preverbal 'done' marking a completive aspect occurs.
come: No preverbal stance 'come' construction appears.
double-modal: There is no sequence of two modals (e.g., 'might could'); only 'did' appears as an auxiliary.
multiple-neg: No clause contains more than one negative element; in fact, no negation occurs.
neg-inversion: No clause begins with a negative auxiliary preceding the subject.
n-inv-neg-concord: There is no negative subject plus negative auxiliary combination.
aint: 'Ain’t' does not appear; no general negative auxiliary is used.
zero-3sg-pres-s: No 3sg present-tense finite verb lacks -s; the main finite verbs are past ('did saw', 'was').
is-was-gen: 'It was a sheet' agrees with the singular subject and is SAE-conforming, not generalized 'is/was'.
zero-pl-s: No clearly plural noun appears without plural -s under a plural determiner.
double-object: There is no personal dative pattern with a coreferential object pronoun plus following NP (e.g., 'got me a…').
wh-qu1: No WH-interrogative is present; thus no missing DO or zero copula in a WH-question.
wh-qu2: No WH-question or embedded WH-clause appears, so no nonstandard inversion applies.
existential-it: 'I guess it was a sheet' uses referential 'it', not existential 'it' introducing new entities.
demonstrative-them: 'Them' does not occur as a determiner before a noun.
appositive-pleonastic-pronoun: No NP is followed by a co-referential pronoun in the same grammatical role within the clause.
bin: No standalone 'been/BIN' occurs without 'have' marking long-standing aspect.
verb-stem: No bare finite verb is used with clear past reference; 'saw' is inflected and other verbs are nonfinite ('to get', 'trying').
past-tense-swap: No participle-for-past or regularized past like 'knowed/seen' is used; 'did saw' is aux+past mismatch not covered by this feature.
zero-rel-pronoun: No finite subject-relative clause lacks a relative pronoun; 'someone climbing' is a nonfinite reduced relative.
preterite-had: There is no 'had' + past verb used to express simple past.
bare-got: Occurrences of 'get' are in infinitival purpose clauses ('to get'); no present-possessive 'got' is used.
